All,

Being most used to Java, I had a quick look an the ANJI 
implementati=
on of NEAT. My questions are:

- to which extent is the ANJI implementation=
 compatible to NEAT ? At 
least it implements an additional mutation for re=
moving connections. 
Does this improve the (modeling) performance ? 

- ANJ=
I seems to use online training - wouldn't batch training be 
advantageous (=
mostly to avoid local minima) ?

- how does one implement the FS-NEAT versi=
on (which automatically 
selects inputs) in ANJI (or JNeat) ? Is there an i=
mplementation 
already available ?

Thanks,
Achim
